meanings.definition: A book in which a person keeps a record of their bank transactions.
meanings.sent1: I always write down my deposits and withdrawals in my bankbook.
meanings.sent2: She opened her bankbook to check her account balance.
meanings.sent3: The bankbook told a tale of spending and saving.
meanings.sent4: Her bankbook was a treasure map of financial decisions.
meanings.sent5: The bankbook held the secrets of her financial life.

meanings.definition: A book issued by a bank to record deposits and withdrawals.
meanings.sent1: The teller handed her a new bankbook to track her transactions.
meanings.sent2: He misplaced his bankbook and had to request a new one from the bank.
meanings.sent3: The bankbook seemed to have a mind of its own, always disappearing when needed.
meanings.sent4: Her bankbook was like a loyal companion, always there to document her financial journey.
meanings.sent5: The bankbook was a reliable tool for managing money.

meanings.definition: A record of a person's financial transactions with a bank.
meanings.sent1: The bankbook showed a history of all her dealings with the bank.
meanings.sent2: He needed to present his bankbook to apply for a loan.
meanings.sent3: The bankbook was like a diary of financial adventures.
meanings.sent4: Her bankbook was a mirror reflecting her financial choices.
meanings.sent5: The bankbook was a window into her financial world.
